intro: Calycomelia pennsylvanica, commonly known as the Pennsylvania calycomelia, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate and have a slightly hairy texture, and it typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands. Calycomelia pennsylvanica is often found in association with other woodland flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
